alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:12PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD HEAVY SNOW AND DANGEROUSLY COLD TEMPERATURES... .Snow will continue across the area late today and into this evening before tapering off from west to east overnight. The combination of snow and breezy winds will lead to difficult travel conditions across northeastern Wyoming and much of South Dakota through tonight. The bitterly cold air will produce wind chills as low as 25 below to 40 below zero across the area through late week. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches across northeast Wyoming, 2 to 5 inches across much of far western South Dakota, and 3 to 7 inches across areas near and east of line from Faith to Kadoka. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern, southwestern and the Black Hills of South Dakota and northeast Wyoming. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation and the Pine Ridge Reservation. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston
